Package edu.sjsu.Team15.model

Class DatabaseHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.sjsu.Team15.model.DatabaseHandler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DomainHandler, UserHandler
    public abstract class DatabaseHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Standard File Handler Offers standard methods for encrypting and decrypting, handling the decrypted file, and having a few additional methods for working with java xml objects. Notes: It can't determine if the file is safe or formatted correctly, so the function relies on the program for it to be used safely and properly. With more time, a verification function can be added, but for the time being, use these classes with caution.

    • Field Detail

      • secureFile

        private java.io.File secureFile
        The file location of the encrypted xml file. Usually ends with .xyt extension

      • activeFile

        private java.io.File activeFile
        The file location of the decrypted xml file. Should point in the temporary directory

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseHandler

        public DatabaseHandler​(java.io.File dataFile,
                       java.io.File tempFile)
        Create a DatabaseHandler Instance. Both file locations must be provided and are used for encrypted and decrypted file locations.
        Parameters:
        dataFile - The database file location
        tempFile - The file location for the decrypted file

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public java.io.File encrypt​(SecureCharBuffer sk,
                            java.lang.String username)
        Encrypt the active file and save it to the secure file location
        Parameters:
        sk - The key used for encryption
        username - The salt used for encryption
        Returns:
        File The location where the secure file was saved

      • decrypt

        public java.io.File decrypt​(SecureCharBuffer sk,
                            java.lang.String username)
        Decrypt the secure file and save it to the active file location
        Parameters:
        sk - The key used for decryption
        username - The salt used for decryption
        Returns:
        File The location where the active file wa saved

      • getActiveFile

        public java.io.File getActiveFile()
        Return the temporary file location, where the decrypted file is
        Returns:
        File The temporary file location

      • setActiveFile

        public java.io.File setActiveFile​(java.lang.String path)
        Change the decrypted file location. Destroys the previous instance of the decrypted file and sets the new location at the specified spot. The only way to destroy tmp file without destroying the DatabaseHandler object.
        Parameters:
        path - The new tmp file location
        Returns:
        The location the tmp file

      • destroyActiveFile

        public java.io.File destroyActiveFile()
        Destroy the decrypted file. Destroys the decrypted file for safety. Call this whenever the file is no longer needed. File location stays, however, so if another tmp file needs to be made, it can be made with a decrypt() call.
        Returns:
        returns file if failed

      • buildDoc

        public static org.w3c.dom.Document buildDoc​(java.io.File current)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a xml document for the java parsers to read
        Parameters:
        current - The file to be converted, or null for a blank file
        Returns:
        The xml object used for parsing
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
